Description: Knob of lid from Chian, probably black-figured, Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; from top: tongue pattern; band; second, larger, tongue frieze; broad band.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For other simple lid knobs, see Louvre AM1362 (26) and Lemos no. 1318 from Emporio.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 315, no. 1355, pl. 175) (Incorrectly labelled no. 1335 on plate.)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 103, no. 309, pl. XXXII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2111) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 214, no. 37)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4747 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
